link_desc:
These two templates use a shell script to get status information from FritzBox routers and FritzRepeaters. It uses CURL and the AVM uPNP interface (see https://avm.de/service/schnittstellen/) to query the information.

Some of the queries need an admin username and password of the FritzBox or FritzRepeater.

Installation

  • Copy "fritzbox.sh" from the attached zip file to /usr/lib/zabbix/Externalscripts. This script only works under Linux.
  • Import the template in Zabbix (one template is for FritzBox routers, the other is for FritzRepeaters)
  • Set your device up as a "host" in Zabbix. Enter the IP (e.g. 192.168.178.1) under the field agent.
  • Enter the FritzBox or FritzRepeater username and password under Macros in the host configuration

The bash script fritzbox.sh is directly called from Zabbix with the required parameters. But you can also use it directly from the command prompts.

fritzbox.sh [COMMAND] [IP/DNS] [USERNAME] [PASSWORD]

  • [COMMAND] = Status request that is supposed to the sent to the FritzBox or FritzRepeater
  • [IP/DNS] = IP address or DNS name of the FritzBox or FritzRepeater
  • [USERNAME] = Optional admin username of the FritzBox or FritzRepeater
  • [PASSWORD] = Optional admin password of the FritzBox or FritzRepeater

Examples:

  • fritzbox.sh ipv4 fritz.box
  • fritzbox.sh version fritz.box admin password

This was inspired by the following scripts:

  • https://github.com/jhubig/FritzBoxShell/blob/master/fritzBoxShell.sh
  • http://schwender-beyer.de/artikel.php?n=3&p=fb.monitoring
